resources.string: QuizApp
Type your name.
I attend to university or school about computer engineering
I attend to university or school about other mechanical field
I have attended only courses
I work in computer industry
I have just started being more than a simple user
Java
C#
C
JavaScript
Ruby
Python
HTML and Css
Matlab
State the conditions that fit you:
Which of the following programming languages do you know how to use?
On which of the following mobile operation systems are you able to make apps?
Android OS(Google Inc.)
Bada (Samsung)
iPhone Os(Apple)
Windows Mobile(Windows)
Other
None
How much are you searching for new technics and ways to improve your coding skills and expand your knowledge?
I scroll through the internet for new complilers,languages,attributes and specific elements of programming languages all the time
Only if I need something that I do not know during the time I work on a project
Not at all
I already know the best technics
Would you consider thinking about a programming tip from a collague or classmate?
Sure, I will try to understand it and use it in my code
I have heard a lot of tips but I do not really think they are good
I do not think that giving/receiving tips is helpful for anyone
They can not possibly know more than me
Do you follow the rules(Commenting,Camel Case naming,etc) during the coding of your projects?
I always follow those rules so my code can be easily read by me or other programmers(This technic makes easier debugging and maintenance of my code)
I sometimes use camel case so I can read my code but I never comment because I know my program by heart
I do not think it is important to follow those rules
Why would I waste my time like that?
How do you face a failure on a project due to past deadline,wrong coding or unable to cooparate with classmates/collagues?
I always try to find the mistakes I made and what knowledge I was missing. I try to talk to the people invlolved to figure out what exactly went wrong
I try to figure out what I did wrong but it is mostly others fault
I tried my best but since I failed I do not care anymore
How can I be wrong? Either the assignment was wrong to begin with or the people I worked with messed up
What do you think about yourself as a programmer?
I have potential and I am sure I have plenty more to learn and much more knowledge to acquire
I am pretty good, sure plenty of space to get better
I am lost in programming I do not think I can make it
I am a perfect programmer and I do not really think that anyone else can be better than me
SUMBIT ANSWERS
